data.meta_description: Discover life events, stories and photos about Stephen Hensley (1842â1915) of Rockingham, Virginia, United States.
data.text:
When Stephen Hensley was born on 23 January 1842, in Rockingham, Virginia, United States, his father, William A Hensley, was 27 and his mother, Lucinda Hensley, was 26. He married Harriet Dean on 1 December 1864, in Belmont, Goshen Township, Belmont, Ohio, United States. They were the parents of at least 6 sons and 7 daughters. He lived in Stonewall District, Rockingham, Virginia, United States for about 20 years. He died on 19 December 1915, in Rockingham, Virginia, United States, at the age of 73, and was buried in Hensley Community Cemetery, Elkton, Rockingham, Virginia, United States.

1844 Â· Lumpkin's Jail

In 1844 when Robert Lumpkin bought land in Virginia, this would be the spot of the Infamous Slave Jail (or Lumpkinâs Jail). The slaves would be brought here during the slave trade until they were sold. Lumpkin had purchased the land for his own slave business.

1846

U.S. acquires vast tracts of Mexican territory in wake of Mexican War including California and New Mexico.

1862 Â· The Battle of Fredericksburg

The Battle of Fredericksburg involved 200,000 troops with General Ambrose Burnside of the army of the Potomac against General Leeâs Army of the North.
